title: Is it redundant to say “the plot of the story”? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, because plot is one element of a story rather than a synonym for a story. Other parts of a story can be characterization, foreshadowing, description, setting, ambience, the dramatis personae, and style. Plot is merely the story’s backbone. So, it’s no more redundant to say “the plot of the story” than it is to say “the backbone of the person,” or “the engine of the car.” Both spinal columns and engines are very important, but they aren’t equivalent to the whole person or the whole car.
